title: Nation Man
description: William Rosen, a young Canadian boxer, leaves his home in Ottawa and joins Canada's effort in the Great War. Inspired by his idol, Stanley Ketchel, he finds himself torn between who he is and who he wants to be. From the infancy of Canadian boxing to the trials of Canada's involvement in WWI, he is exposed to the mysteries of European folklore and hardships of the battlefield. Along this journey his path intertwines with fellow countrymen that leads him into a tale of mystery, ambition and the eternal struggle of perception.
author: Ryan Stead
